title: Concerns over focus on skin colour in newborn checks
description: A report questions the language used for some checks, including assessing whether the baby is "pink all over".

title: World Eskimo-Indian Olympics: How ripped ears are preserving a rare culture in Alaska
description: How the traditions of the hunt from hundreds of years before live on in an unusual annual sporting event in Alaska.

title: Northstowe: The broken-promise new town built 'with no heart'
description: Northstowe will be the UK's biggest new town since the development of Milton Keynes in the 1960s.

title: Kick It Out: Record-high reports of discrimination up 65% in 2022-23 season
description: Anti-discrimination charity Kick It Out received a 65% rise in reported incidents of discriminatory behaviour during the 2022-23 season.

title: Ex-Manson follower Leslie Van Houten released from prison after 53 years
description: Leslie Van Houten was convicted in the 1969 slaying of a California couple alongside Charles Manson.

title: Student fears having to quit UK over uni marking boycott
description: Emma MacKenzie, from Canada, says she cannot renew her visa if she does not get her degree.

title: Tiger Woods and Rory McIlroy could have owned LIV franchises as Senate considers PGA Tour/PIF deal
description: Tiger Woods and Rory McIlroy could have been offered ownership of LIV team franchises as part of the proposed deal designed to bring peace to world golf.

title: Sunak: No decision yet on public sector pay rises
description: The prime minister says he would make the "responsible" decision to keep inflation under control.

title: BBC presenter: What is the evidence?
description: Ros Atkins examines four questions that relate to the initial Sun newspaper allegations.

title: BBC presenter row: Key questions remain for corporation and The Sun
description: The row about the BBC presenter has developed into a series of claims and counter-claims.

title: Tewkesbury school: Boy charged over teacher stabbing
description: A 15-year-old is charged with attempted wounding with intent and possession of bladed article.

title: Jury rules document found in Aretha Franklin's couch is valid will
description: A jury rules that a hand-written document found in Aretha Franklin's couch is a valid will to her estate.

title: Wimbledon 2023: Novak Djokovic beats Andrey Rubley to reach semi-finals
description: Watch highlights as Novak Djokovic beats seventh seed Andrey Rublev to maintain his bid for a record-equalling eighth Wimbledon men's title.

title: Wimbledon 2023 preview: Carlos Alcaraz, Holger Rune, Ons Jabeur & Elena Rybakina feature on day 10
description: Holger Rune says it will be "cool" to face Carlos Alcaraz, who he played doubles with as a 13-year-old, on a day of reunions and rematches at Wimbledon.

title: Wimbledon 2023: Elina Svitolina says war has made her stronger after reaching semis
description: Ukrainian Elina Svitolina says war in her homeland has made her mentally stronger after she reaches a surprise Wimbledon semi-final.

title: Edwin van der Sar: Former Netherlands goalkeeper not in 'life-threatening danger'
description: Edwin van der Sar remains in intensive care but is not in "life-threatening danger" following a bleed on his brain, says his wife.

title: Wimbledon 2023: Marketa Vondrousova takes best shot on day nine at Wimbledon
description: Watch the best shots from day nine at Wimbledon featuring Marketa Vondrousova and Novak Djokovic.

title: Wimbledon 2023 results: Novak Djokovic beats Andrey Rublev to set up Jannik Sinner semi-final
description: Novak Djokovic sets up a semi-final against Jannik Sinner as he continues his pursuit of a record-equalling eighth Wimbledon men's title.

title: Dylan Thomas' copy of first poetry book up for auction
description: The copy was part of late Rolling Stones drummer Charlie Watts' literature collection.

title: Wimbledon 2023: Jannick Sinner beats Roman Safiullin to reach first Grand Slam semi-final
description: Italy's Jannik Sinner produces some "stunning tennis" to beat Russian Roman Safiullin and reach his first Grand Slam semi-final.

title: Pack of Wotsits used to rescue missing parrot
description: A snack-loving macaw flies away from its care home base after being spooked by a clap of thunder.

title: Royal Mail workers end long-running row over pay
description: The deal to end the dispute comes after 115,000 postal workers held 18 days of strikes last year.

title: Far-right Finnish leader Riikka Purra sorry in racist posts uproar
description: Riikka Purra admits making the comments in 2008, while Finland's PM says there is no tolerance of racism.

title: Major League Cricket: American T20 franchise wants England's top players
description: Major League Cricket wants to sign up England's best players for future editions of the tournament.

title: Nutmeg co-founder Nick Hungerford dies aged 43, months after setting up charity
description: Nick Hungerford was inspired by his young daughter to set up a charity to support bereaved children.

title: Essex lorry deaths: Marius Draghici jailed for more than 12 years
description: A judge is told Marius Draghici was an "essential cog" in the operation that killed the 39 people.

title: Nato summit: Allies refuse to give Ukraine timeframe on joining
description: The alliance says Kyiv can join "when conditions are met" as President Zelensky criticises "absurd" delay.

title: Tour de France: Pello Bilbao dedicates victory to Gino Mader after winning stage 10
description: Spanish rider Pello Bilbao dedicates his victory to his late Bahrain-Victorious team-mate Gino Mader after winning stage 10 of the Tour de France.

title: Wimbledon 2023: Ukraine's Elina Svitolina beats Iga Swiatek to reach semi-finals
description: Watch highlights as Elina Svitolina stuns top seed Iga Swiatek, becoming only the third wildcard to reach a women's singles Wimbledon semi-final in the Open era.

description: England captain Heather Knight is hopeful England can pull off cricket's "great escape" by overturning Australia's six-point lead in the Ashes.

title: Wimbledon 2023: Caroline Wozniacki says she is playing 'as well as ever' on comeback trail

title: Lil Nas X reportedly stopped by Norwegian police after e-scooter error

title: BBC presenter sent abusive and menacing messages to second young person

title: Wimbledon 2023 results: Marketa Vondrousova beats fourth seed Jessica Pegula to reach semi-finals

title: Lord Ahmed: Disgraced peer fails in bid to overturn conviction

title: Lilia Valutyte stabbing: Man killed nine-year-old girl, jury finds

description: Lawyers for the former US president argue a December trial would deny them reasonable time to prepare.

title: What is the UK inflation rate and why is it so high?
description: The rate at which prices are rising remains high, driven by soaring food prices.

title: Romelu Lukaku: Inter Milan hoping to complete deal for Chelsea striker

description: Nathan Law's parents and brother have been taken for questioning after police raided their home.

title: Ben Roberts-Smith: Australia's top soldier appeals over war crimes defamation trial

title: Tewkesbury school to reopen after teacher stabbing
description: Police continue to question a teenage boy after a teacher was taken to hospital with a stab wound.

title: Thieves target musician's crashed car

title: King of the Big Stomach: Chinese eatery in trouble over dumpling-eating race

title: Head teacher defends locking school toilets during lesson time
description: She says having pupils going to the toilet during a lesson is "massively disruptive".

description: The government intervened in eight takeovers of UK firms by Chinese buyers last year, figures show

description: Nato is split over inviting Ukraine to join the alliance. Ukraine fears what happens if they don't.

description: A planned briefing on the broadcaster's performance is expected to be dominated by the scandal.

title: US think tank founder charged with acting as Chinese agent

title: The Papers: 'BBC presenter did nothing wrong' and 'the BBC are liars'
